title: Dakota Johnson launches TeaTime Pictures production company with former Netflix exec Ro Donnelly
text:
Dakota Johnson has made her mark in Hollywood as a bankable leading lady beginning with her role as Anastasia Steele in the Fifty Shades film series.

Now the actress, 30, will be focusing some of her attention and creativity from behind-the-scenes by teaming up with former Netflix development executive Ro Donnelly to form TeaTime Pictures, a feature film and television production company.

The company has already signed a first-look television deal with Platform One Media, and has already earmarked a young-adult musical for its first project under the new pact, Deadline reported.

Star: Dakota Johnson has made her mark in Hollywood as a bankable leading lady beginning with her role as Anastasia Steele in the Fifty Shades film series; pictured on September 28 at the 2019 Global Citizen Festival at Central Park in NYC

'We are thrilled to partner with Dakota and Ro as they build their company,' said Platform One Media exec Katie O'Connell Marsh.

'TeaTime centers on the artists and meaningful content that champion bold ideas and elucidate the stories of the disenfranchised.'

Marsh added, 'We are excited about the extraordinary and curated slate they are putting together and look forward to bringing these projects to market over the next year.'

News: Now the actress, 30, will be focusing some of her attention and creativity from behind-the-scenes by teaming up with former Netflix development executive Ro Donnelly to form TeaTime Pictures, a feature film and television production company; pictured with sister Grace Johnson on October 8 in West Hollywood

Along with the TV deal, TeaTime also has a number of films in some phase of development that includes Queens Of The Stoned for Sony Pictures.

There had been reports that Johnson was in talks to star in the adaption of Suketu Mehta's GQ article of the same name, according to Tracking News in 2017.

TeaTime is also focused on the courtroom drama Unfit for Amazon, which also had Johnson's name attached to it in a Variety article 2017, and Lunacy with Matt Reeves' production company 6th & Idaho.

The company also have a miniseries based on Ruth Coker Burks in the works with Christina Won and Jessica Sittig of MakeSay.

In character: Johnson had her breakout leading lady role in the Fifty Shades film series, beginning with Fifty Shades of Grey in 2015

Most recently, Johnson has starred in a number of film projects in 2019 that included the acclaimed comedy drama film The Peanut Butter Falcon with Shia LaBeouf.

She also stars in the drama film The Friend alongside Casey Affleck and Jason Segel which premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival in September, and the psychological horror Hulu film Wounds, alongside Armie Hammer and Zazie Beetz.

The daughter of actors Don Johnson and Melanie Griffith has the lead role in the upcoming comedy film Covers with Tracee Ellis Ross and Kelvin Harrison Jr. that's slated to be released in May 2020.

While with Netflix, Donnelly worked in the series department where she oversaw the productions of shows such as The Umbrella Academy, American Vandal, The Society and the upcoming I Am Not Okay With This.
description: Dakota Johnson launched the new feature film and television production company TeaTime Pictures with former Netflix executive Ro Donnelly.
